Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2007 07:53AM mitch39 wrote: I am positive i am having a lumpectomy as i have already signed the form. Last tuesday i went to see the surgeon about the bruising and he didnt seemed concerned and htat the best thing to do is to remove this mass as he calls it, i can hardly feel it because of the swelling. The bruising today is alot better still a little bruising and the swelling is still there. I am wondering dont you need all the symptoms of IBC to be, the areola is a mishaped and slight bruising and the swelling is all i have. The bruising came five days after the FNA so i dont know if the bruising is from that, beings i had a small bruise were the needle went in which cleared in two days after the biopsy, then on the fifth day the breast was extremely bruised with raised veins and the areola was dark and swollen, warm to the touch. I am just so confused but i am worried for the lumpectomy on Wednesday, my husband thinks just get the mass removed.

Posts.Content: mitch39 wrote: Has anyone had extreme bruising and swelling and some blood vessel were raised five days after a FNA. Its been 11 days now and around the areola it is still real dark bruising and the breast is still swollen, i went to the doctor last tuesday and he thinks it is ok and that the biopsy wasnt in yet and he has decided to do a lumpectomy next wednesday. When i first went to him the lump i felt was small and was at the the 3 oclock on the left breast when he did the biopsy he was more over in the center above the areola and he told my husband the lump is here so iam a little worried. My husband said he called it a mass, should i be concerned. The mammo and ultrasound were ok mammo done in Oct and ultrasound in Jan. I had no swelling in October but near the end of Dec i noticed the left breast was bigger then the right about a cup size difference. Log in to post a reply

But i am so scared, what do they mean when they say a mass?? My husband thought the surgeon said a mass of breast tissue, do they remove that and then take to pathology. If my left breast wasnt bigger then the other i would probably wait and get a second opinion but it is a cup size bigger then the other since the end of dec. and it hasnt changed in size but it hasnt really got bigger, oh so confused and dont know what to do. Another thing that has me scared is that i had a biopsy in Oct and never had much bruising very very little and then this last biopsy same biopsy and five days after that biopsy my breast got hot, bruised black and purple with raised veins and swelling of the breast, and it has gotten better but i am still concerned has this happened to any one else.
